Material used.Description: Cells were incubated with serum-free DMEM for 1 h to deplete cells of transferrin followed by washes and incubation with 55FeCl3.

Readout description.Result Description: DMT1-mediated iron uptake in SD-A53T cells showed synergistic toxicity with iron treatment, leading to increased cell death.
DMT1-mediated iron uptake in SD-A30P cells showed increased toxicity with iron treatment, though less severe than A53T.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple stable clonal SH-SY5Y cell lines were analyzed and selected for experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Control SH-SY5Y cell line (S-V) was used as a negative control for iron uptake comparison.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) with Bonferroni's post hoc test, p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Iron uptake levels comparable to control SH-SY5Y cells (S-V).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in iron uptake (e.g., 300-fold increase as seen in S-DMT1 cells).

Material used.Description: Cells were cultured with daily changes of DMEM containing 100 µM FeCl2 for up to 6 days, and cell viability was determined.

Readout description.Result Description: SD-A53T cell line showed a significant reduction in cell viability (approximately 2-fold decrease) compared to SD-V from day 4 onward.
SD-A30P cell line showed increased cell death peaking at day 5, though less severe than A53T.

Biological replicates.Description: Data shown are representative of three independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: SD-V cell line was used as a negative control for comparison of cell viability.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) with Bonferroni's post hoc test, p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability comparable to SD-V control cell line.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in cell viability (e.g., 2-fold decrease as seen in SD-A53T cells).

Material used.Description: Cell lysates were prepared after 4 days of Fe2+ treatment to determine cellular oxidative stress levels using the OxyBlot Protein Oxidation Detection kit.

Readout description.Result Description: SD-A53T cells showed a 4-fold increase in oxidized proteins after 4 days of 100 µM FeCl2 treatment compared to SD-WT and SD-A30P.
SD-A30P cells showed increased oxidative damage, though less severe than SD-A53T.

Biological replicates.Description: Mean fold change compared to control group from three independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated cells and SD-V cell line were used as negative controls for oxidative damage comparison.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) with Bonferroni's post hoc test, p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oxidative damage levels comparable to untreated control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in oxidized proteins (e.g., 4-fold increase as seen in SD-A53T cells).

Material used.Description: Harvested cells were analyzed for single and double strand DNA breaks after 4 days of iron treatment using the comet assay procedure.

Readout description.Result Description: SD-A53T cells showed substantial DNA damage after 4 days of 100 µM FeCl2 treatment compared to minimal damage in SD-V controls.
SD-A30P cells showed increased DNA damage, though less severe than SD-A53T.

Biological replicates.Description: A minimum of triplicate sets for each treatment and cell line were carried out.

Basic positive control.Description: Hydrogen peroxide was used as a positive control for DNA damage.

Basic negative control.Description: SD-V cell line and untreated cells were used as negative controls for DNA damage comparison.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) with Bonferroni's post hoc test, p < 0.0001.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Minimal DNA damage comparable to SD-V control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in tail moment indicating substantial DNA damage (as seen in SD-A53T cells).

Material used.Description: Cells grown on coverslips were incubated with 0.05 mM MDC in PBS to stain autophagolysosomes after iron treatment.

Readout description.Result Description: SD-A53T cells showed a 2-fold increase in MDC fluorescence intensity after 4 days of iron treatment, indicating increased autophagolysosomes.
SD-A30P cells did not show a significant increase in autophagy compared to SD-A53T.

Biological replicates.Description: Quantification of fluorescence intensity of at least 100 cells per condition.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated SD-A53T cells were used as a negative control for autophagy comparison.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) with Bonferroni's post hoc test, p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: MDC fluorescence intensity comparable to untreated control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in MDC fluorescence intensity (e.g., 2-fold increase as seen in SD-A53T cells).

Material used.Description: Cells were fixed in 2.5% glutaraldehyde in PBS for 2 h and postfixed in osmium tetroxide for ultrastructural analysis of autophagosomes.

Readout description.Result Description: SD-A53T cells showed more autophagosomes compared to SD-V cells after iron treatment.
SD-A30P cells did not show a significant increase in autophagosomes compared to SD-A53T.

Biological replicates.Description: Quantification by stereology confirmed differences across multiple fields.

Basic positive control.Description: Starved cells were used as a positive control for autophagy.

Basic negative control.Description: SD-V cells treated with iron showed little evidence of cellular vacuolization.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) with Bonferroni's post hoc test, p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Minimal presence of autophagosomes comparable to SD-V control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in the number of autophagosomes (as seen in SD-A53T cells).
